newsitem.title: UK: LME copper ticks higher in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LME copper ticks higher in late trading.

text.p: LME copper prices edged closer to the nearby $2,130 resistance level in late inter-office trading on Monday, building on moderate gains in the afternoon kerb.
At 1900 GMT three months copper was indicated at $2,128/32, compared to $2,114 at the afternoon kerb close.
Brisk borrowing of the January dates and resultant widening backwardation helped boost values, traders said.
But business was patchy ahead of the Christmas holidays and traders said they expected copper to remain within a recent broad range barring unexpected news or surprise LME stock movements.
On the upside, significant resistance was seen at $2,150, while support was at $2,080.
The other metals were little changed. Aluminium, which had followed copper slightly higher, was indicated at $1,537/39 versus $1,537 at the afternoon kerb close.
